meanings.definition: To make or become Arabic in language or culture.
meanings.sent1: She arabicized her name to fit in with her new friends.
meanings.sent2: The traditional dish was arabicized with the addition of exotic spices.
meanings.sent3: The English book arabicized itself when it accidentally fell into a pool of Arabic coffee.
meanings.sent4: His music arabicized the audience, transporting them to a bustling Middle Eastern market.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors and intricate patterns arabicized the room, giving it an exotic feel.

meanings.definition: To convert or adapt something to Arabic style or form.
meanings.sent1: The tailor arabicized the dress by adding intricate embroidery.
meanings.sent2: The architect arabicized the building by incorporating traditional Arabic arches.
meanings.sent3: The cake arabicized itself with a sprinkle of aromatic saffron.
meanings.sent4: Her dance arabicized the routine, infusing it with graceful Arabic movements.
meanings.sent5: The art piece arabicized the gallery, standing out with its Arabic calligraphy.
